questions.question: From what point of view is "Charles" told?

choices.answer: First Person- From Laurie's Point of View
First Person- From Laurie's Mother's Point of View
Second Person
Third Person Limited

questions.question: What is the mother's impression of Laurie on the day he starts kindergarten?

choices.answer: He seems less sweet and innocent
He seems less mature
He seems sly
He seems shy

questions.question: Which phrase best describes the boy Charles?

choices.answer: Class scholar
Class dunce
Class leader
Class troublemaker

questions.question: Why is Laurie's mother interested in meeting Charles's mother?

choices.answer: She wants to help her
She thinks someone with a bad child would be interesting
She suspects there is no Charles
She assumes she will be like her

questions.question: What do you think Laurie's mother realizes at the end of the story?

choices.answer: The teacher doesn't know how to control her class
Laurie has learned many bad things from Charles
Laurie was just joking about Charles
Laurie is the bad boy who did the things he said Charles did

questions.question: Which of these details hint at the suprise ending?

choices.answer: Laurie tells his parents that Charles is fresh
Laurie tells his parents that Charles hit the teacher
Laurie tells his father, "Look at my thumb. Gee, you're dumb."
Laurie predicts that they may throw Charles out of school

questions.question: Why does Laurie say that the whole class had to stay late?

choices.answer: The teacher makes everyone stay late to punish one child
Laurie doesn't want his parents to know he went somewhere else.
Laurie is trying to hide that he is the badly behaved child
Laurie stays late to walk home with a friend.

questions.question: If someone gives you a gift and you view it, "cyncially,"  which statement do you believe?

choices.answer: The person is a true friend
People are very generous
The gift is important
The person wants a favor from you

questions.question: What is the mother's impression of Laurie BEFORE he starts kindergarten?

choices.answer: She sees him as a sweet little boy
She sees him as a noisy boy
She sees him as a mean nasty boy
She sees him as a shy boy

questions.question: How do the readers learn what the person named Charles is like?

choices.answer: Laurie, as narrator, tells us about him
Laurie's mother reports what Laurie says about Charles
Laurie teacher writes reports about him
The narrator tells us Charles's thoughts and feelings
Telling a lie
Inventing a friend
Falling down
Doing anything bad

questions.question: How does Laurie's mother expect Charles's mother to look?

choices.answer: Cheerful
Confident
Tired
Evil

questions.question: How does the point of view contribute to the surprise ending?

choices.answer: The narrator doesn't know the truth so neither do the readers.
The narrator portrays Laurie as angelic so his bad behavior shocks readers
The author tells many character's thoughts, so the readers aren't suprised
The narrator is dishonest, so the readers are tricked until the end.

questions.question: Why is the mother's concern about Charles funny once you know the ending?

choices.answer: Her son is Charles's best friend
Her son is just as bad as Charles
Her son is well behaved
Her son is the boy who is misbehaving

questions.question: You would be mostly likely to do things simultaneously if you were....

choices.answer: Tired
Not too bright
Trying to kill time
Multi-tasking
